column5: During your time on UT Austin campus, how has the construction noises around your environment affected you?
column7: Comments

column8: PCL/UTC, UT Tower/Lawn, Burdine Hall, PMA/Physics, Math, Astronomy Building

column7: loud, cat study or focus for exam, takes a we to walk around area to get to class
Very annoying to walk past every day going to school and wakes me up in the mornings
Can be distracting during class, at one point in the fall I was taking an exam in the UTC and there was construction going on right outside the classroom throughout the entire duration.
I have a class in Garrison and there is very loud construction outside the window.

I wake up several morning to construction noises and sometimes get headaches when it's especially loud </3 It's also hard to talk on the phone or talk to neighbors in certain areas of campus because of the noise, so I have to avoid them.
column8: Union Building, PMA/Physics, Math, Astronomy Building

column7: I feel like me being near the dust has led to me getting sick or making the sickness worse if it wasn't what caused it.

column8: PCL/UTC, UT Tower/Lawn, Union Building, GDC/WEL

column7: Roof replacement at the CMA made loud drilling noises while I was trying to work all summer. We also frequently had to move spaces to find working locations that were less loud.

column7: Taking detours
Interrupted concentration, making it harder to learn and study
Can be very loud when studying outside
it’s just annoying
They affect my access of the campus , cutting off certain roads and views, making my enjoyability of the campus environment decrease.
Sometimes they are loud when I am trying to study for exams or complete assignments
Na
Hasn’t effected me

going out of my way to the block the noise

column7: I live near a construction area, so I hear construction a lot. It is also in the background during classes. I've gotten used to tuning it out so I wouldn't say it has a big effect.

column7: It's too loud
It’s just a lot on the way when I’m heading to the eer on 24 th street

column5: 5 - Extremely affected, consistently disruptive and stressful
column7: The constant high rise buildings in WAMPUS being built have woken me up consistently a couple times every week this whole year.
column8: PCL/UTC, UT Tower/Lawn, WAMPUS, the standard

column7: sometimes made it hard to sleep or concentrate on my studies or homework
Sometimes during class, it’ll disrupt me from what the professor is saying especially if the windows are open.

Construction as well as traffic noises cause me a base level of low stress and withdrawal when outside, and subtly keep me from wanting to leave home. It’s generally distressing to constantly see and hear huge machines destroying land and infrastructure and remaking them with noxious smelling materials every day. I understand some of it’s important but a lot of it isn’t at the degree we use it.
column8: SZB/Education Building, How bout that RLP?:)

column7: I haven't faced any huge issues. It's inconvenience for sure.
